item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：欧盟拟征收进口关税，矛头直指中国的特姆优和申银万国
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周三援引三位知情人士的话报道称，欧盟正在制定计划，对从中国在线零售商（包括特卖和申银）购买的廉价商品征收关税。【原文：The European Union is drawing up plans to impose customs duties on cheap goods bought from Chinese online retailers including Temu and Shein, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing three people briefed on the matter.】

item.title: 现代汽车和 LG Energy Solution 启动印尼首家电动汽车电池工厂
item.description: 韩国现代汽车集团（Hyundai Motor Group）和 LG Energy Solution (LGES) 周三为印尼首家电动汽车电池生产厂举行了落成典礼，该厂的电池年产能为 10 千兆瓦时（GWh）。【原文：South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group and LG Energy Solution (LGES) on Wednesday inaugurated Indonesia's first battery cell production plant for electric vehicles with an annual capacity of 10 Gigawatt hours (GWh) of battery cells.】

item.title: 数据显示，人工智能交易使美国风险投资资金达到两年来的最高水平
item.description: 周三公布的 PitchBook 数据显示，第二季度美国风险投资资金猛增至 556 亿美元，创下两年来最高季度总额。【原文：U.S. venture capital funding surged to $55.6 billion in the second quarter, marking the highest quarterly total in two years, according to PitchBook data published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 现代汽车和 LG Energy Solution 启动印尼首家电动汽车电池工厂
item.description: 韩国现代汽车集团（Hyundai Motor Group）和LG能源解决方案公司（LG Energy Solution）周三启动了印尼首家电动汽车电池生产厂，该厂的电池年产能为10吉瓦时（GWh）。【原文：South Korea's Hyundai Motor Group and LG Energy Solution on Wednesday launched Indonesia's first battery cell production plant for electric vehicles with an annual capacity of 10 Gigawatt hours (GWh) of battery cells.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因降息预期而上涨，日元维持在 38 年低点附近
item.description: 亚洲股市周三上涨，原因是美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的言论增强了人们对美国降息为期不远的预期，而日元汇率仍被压制在1986年最后一次出现的水平附近，使交易商对日本的干预保持警惕。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Wednesday as comments from Fed Chair Jerome Powell reinforced expectations that U.S. rate cuts were not far off, while the yen remained pinned near levels last seen in 1986, keeping traders wary of Japanese intervention.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示中国服务业活动增速创8个月新低
item.description: 周三的一项私营部门调查显示，受新订单增长放缓的拖累，6月份中国服务业活动增速为八个月来最慢，信心指数创四年新低，这表明中国需要更多的经济刺激措施。【原文：China's services activity expanded at the slowest pace in eight months and confidence hit a four-year low in June, dragged by slower growth in new orders, a private-sector survey showed on Wednesday, suggesting more economic stimulus is needed.】

item.title: 韩国经济增长强劲，誓言为小企业提供支持
item.description: 韩国总统尹锡烈（Yoon Suk Yeol）周三表示，韩国政府已准备好为因高利率而陷入困境的小企业提供财政支持，并上调了对今年经济增长的预测。【原文：South Korea's government has prepared financial support for small businesses struggling due to high interest rates, President Yoon Suk Yeol said on Wednesday, as it revised up its forecast for this year's economic growth.】

item.title: 油价因美国原油库存大幅减少而上扬
item.description: 周三，油价在亚洲早盘交易中走高，此前行业数据显示美国原油库存的减少幅度大于预期，从而提振了人们对美国这个最大石油消费国夏季驾车季节燃料需求稳固的希望。【原文：Oil prices edged higher in early Asian trade on Wednesday after industry data showed a bigger-than-expected draw in U.S. crude stockpiles, boosting hopes of solid fuel demand during the summer driving season in the top oil consuming nation.】

item.title: Blackstone 向 MBK Partners 出售日本制药商 Alinamin
item.description: Blackstone 和 MBK Partners 周三表示，这家美国私募股权投资公司将向北亚收购基金出售日本制药商 Alinamin Pharmaceutical。【原文：Blackstone and MBK Partners said on Wednesday the U.S. private equity firm is selling Japanese drugmaker Alinamin Pharmaceutical to the North Asian buyout fund.】

item.title: 日本服务业采购经理人指数显示日本服务业活动两年来首次下滑
item.description: 本周三，一项私营部门调查显示，由于国内需求降温，6 月份日本服务业活动出现了近两年来的首次萎缩，尽管商业信心和招聘指标仍然保持乐观。【原文：Japanese service activity contracted for the first time in nearly two years in June as domestic demand cooled, a private sector survey showed on Wednesday, although business confidence and hiring indicators remained upbeat.】

item.title: 日本 20 年来首次使用全息图识别假钞
item.description: 日本于本周三开始流通 20 年来首张新钞，新钞上印有金融和女性教育机构创始人的三维肖像，以挫败造假者。【原文：Japan began circulating its first new banknotes in 20 years on Wednesday, featuring three-dimensional portraits of the founders of financial and female education institutions in an attempt to frustrate counterfeiters.】

item.title: 拉塔姆航空公司将重新上市美国存托凭证并进行二次销售
item.description: 拉塔姆航空公司周二表示，该公司打算按照某些股东的要求，在根据所谓的登记权协议进行首次二次销售的同时，继续美国存托凭证（ADR）的重新上市进程。【原文：LATAM Airlines said on Tuesday it intends to proceed with the process of re-listing American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in tandem with the first secondary sale under the so-called registration rights agreement, which certain shareholders requested.】

item.title: 美国电动汽车制造商前路坎坷，尽管季度销量喜人
item.description: 在高利率引发需求急剧放缓之后，第二季度美国电动汽车销量好于预期，这让投资者松了一口气，但电动汽车制造商仍面临着崎岖的前路。【原文：Better-than-expected U.S. electric-vehicle sales in the second quarter brought welcome relief to investors after a sharp slowdown in demand triggered by high interest rates, but EV makers still face a bumpy road ahead.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Skydance Media 与 Shari Redstone 的 National Amusements 达成新协议
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，Skydance Media 已达成初步协议，将收购 Shari Redstone 的家族公司 National Amusements 并与 Paramount Global 合并。【原文：Skydance Media has reached a preliminary agreement to buy Shari Redstone's family company National Amusements and merge with Paramount Global , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: SLB、ChampionX 收到美国司法部的第二次请求，要求提供拟议的 80 亿美元交易细节
item.description: 油田服务公司 SLB 周二表示，已收到美国司法部就其斥资 77.5 亿美元收购较小竞争对手 ChampionX 的交易提出的第二次补充信息请求。【原文：Oilfield services company SLB said on Tuesday it has received a second request for additional information from the United States Department of Justice in connection with its $7.75 billion acquisition deal for smaller rival ChampionX .】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称星座公司正与宾夕法尼亚州商谈三哩岛重启事宜
item.description: 本周二，三位熟悉讨论情况的消息人士称，星座能源公司正在与宾夕法尼亚州州长办公室和州立法者进行谈判，以帮助资助其三里岛核电站（上世纪 70 年代的核泄漏事故发生地）部分设施的可能重启。【原文：Constellation Energy is in talks with the Pennsylvania governor's office and state lawmakers to help fund a possible restart of part of its Three Mile Island power facility, the site of a nuclear meltdown in the 1970s, three sources familiar with the discussions said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：为股市反弹奠定基础，服务业采购经理人指数即将公布
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 法院官员的代表报告称，在 Citgo 母公司的拍卖中出现了多次竞标
item.description: 负责监督出售过程的法院官员代表周二表示，炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司股份的第二轮竞标 "很成功"，美国联邦法院上个月收到了几份有竞争力的竞标。【原文：The second bidding round for shares in refiner Citgo Petroleum's parent was "successful," with several competitive bids received last month by a U.S. federal court, a representative of the court officer overseeing the sale process said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，人工智能编码初创公司 Magic 在新一轮融资中寻求 15 亿美元的估值
item.description: 三位消息人士告诉路透社，美国一家开发人工智能模型编写软件的初创公司Magic正在洽谈一轮超过2亿美元的融资，估值达15亿美元，这距离它上一次融资仅过去了几个月。【原文：Magic, a U.S. startup developing artificial-intelligence models to write software, is in talks to raise over $200 million in a funding round valuing it at $1.5 billion, just several months after its last capital raise, three sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 消息人士称埃克森-赫斯仲裁小组即将成立
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，埃克森美孚针对雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司的索赔案成立了一个三人仲裁小组，该小组的最后一名成员已经选定。【原文：The final member has been chosen for a three-person arbitration panel meant to settle Exxon Mobil's claim against Chevron's $53 billion purchase of Hess Corp , two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，作为人工智能协议的一部分，苹果公司有望获得 OpenAI 董事会观察员的职位
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，作为上个月宣布的具有里程碑意义的人工智能协议的一部分，苹果公司将在 OpenAI 董事会中担任观察员。【原文：Apple will get an observer role on OpenAI's board as part of a landmark AI agreement announced last month, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Rivian 否认与大众汽车进行生产谈判的媒体报道
item.description: 周二有媒体报道称，美国电动汽车公司正在与大众汽车公司进行早期谈判，以扩大双方在最近宣布的软件合资企业之外的合作关系，Rivian否认了这一报道。【原文：Rivian denied a media report on Tuesday that said the U.S. electric vehicle company was in early talks with Volkswagen to extend their partnership beyond a recently announced software joint venture.】

item.title: 苹果前律师因内幕交易被美国证券交易委员会罚款 115 万美元
item.description: 一名联邦法官周二裁定，苹果公司前高级律师在承认内幕交易罪后避免了牢狱之灾，他必须在美国证券交易委员会的相关民事案件中支付 115 万美元的罚款。【原文：The former senior Apple lawyer who avoided prison time after pleading guilty to insider trading must pay a $1.15 million fine in a related U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission civil case, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.】

item.title: 福特通过新的租赁政策敦促其经理购买更多电动汽车
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的福特汽车公司上周发送的一封内部邮件，福特汽车公司正试图让更多的经理人购买电动汽车。【原文：Ford Motor is trying to get more of its managers to buy electric vehicles, according to an internal email the automaker sent last week that was reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 据《财富》杂志报道，沃尔玛已就出售其关闭的医疗诊所进行了谈判
item.description: 据《财富》周二援引多位熟悉内情的消息人士的话报道，沃尔玛已与潜在买家就出售已关闭的医疗诊所进行了谈判。【原文：Walmart has held talks with potential buyers to sell its already shuttered medical clinics, Fortune reported on Tuesday, citing multiple sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Vista Equity 正在商谈将 Pluralsight 移交债权人事宜
item.description: 据三位熟悉此事的人士和路透社查阅的基金文件显示，私募股权公司 Vista Equity 正在商谈将其公司 Pluralsight 的控制权让给贷款人。【原文：Private equity firm Vista Equity is in talks to cede control of its company Pluralsight to lenders, according to three people familiar with the matter and fund documents reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 FDA 批准礼来公司的阿尔茨海默氏症药物
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局周二为礼来公司用于治疗早期阿尔茨海默病患者的多那尼单抗开了绿灯，使其成为第二种获准用于延缓这种脑损伤疾病进展的药物。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday gave a green light to Eli Lilly's donanemab for patients with early Alzheimer's, making it the second approved drug for slowing the progress of the brain-wasting disease.】

item.title: Progressive 将支付 4,800 万美元，以了结低估失事汽车价值的指控
item.description: Progressive 同意支付 4800 万美元，以了结一项集体诉讼，该诉讼指控该保险公司系统性地低估了车辆失事的纽约司机的索赔金额。【原文：Progressive agreed to pay $48 million to settle a class action lawsuit accusing the insurer of systematically undervaluing the claims of New York drivers whose vehicles were wrecked.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，伊坎旗下炼油企业 CVR 正在参与 Citgo 股份竞拍
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的人士透露，由亿万富翁投资者卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）控制的炼油企业 CVR Energy 已在委内瑞拉 Citgo Petroleum 母公司正在进行的股份拍卖中提交了一份具有约束力的报价。【原文：Oil refiner CVR Energy , controlled by billionaire investor Carl Icahn, has submitted a binding offer in an ongoing auction of shares in the parent of Venezuela-owned Citgo Petroleum, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 开发银行因气候条款和混合债券获得评级提升
item.description: 惠誉（Fitch）周二表示，冻结受气候灾害影响国家的债务偿付不会影响这些银行的信用评级，而且将不再对新的 "混合 "债券设定评级上限，世界银行和其他顶级开发银行因此获得双重激励。【原文：The World Bank and other top development banks got a double boost on Tuesday as Fitch said debt payment freezes for climate-disaster hit countries would not hit the banks' credit rating and it would no longer cap ratings on new 'hybrid' bonds.】
